title: Ne se met pas a jour quand il n'y a pas de réseau.
body:
Bonjour,

Je viens de voir que l'application affiche le dernier émetteur détecté alors que je n'ai que les appels d'urgences qui sont possible.

Ne serait-ce pas un bug ?

title: Bugs report - notif spam
body:
**ENGLISH** :
Hi,

I want to report you a bug :
I have a Samsung Galaxy S7 (mobile opérator : Free, in France)

In the "preferences" menu when the "Free 4G mobile sound alarm" option is set, the notification is spammed . If my mobile is in vibrate mode (no sound), the vibrator turns on every 2s or less, if the mobile is in sound mode, there is the same problem with the defined sound.

I can transmit you every file you need (if you explain me where I can find it)


**FRENCH** :
Bonjour,

Je veux vous signaler un bug:
J'ai un Samsung Galaxy S7 (opérateur mobile: Free, en France)

Dans le menu "Préférences" lorsque l'option " Alarme sonore Free Mobile 4G" est définie, la notification est spammée. Si le mobile est en mode vibreur, le vibreur s'active toutes les 2s ou moins, si le mobile est en mode sonore, il y a le même problème avec le son.

Je peux vous transmettre tous les fichiers dont vous avez besoin (si vous m'expliquez où je peux le trouver sur le tél)

title: App should have high priority notification level
body: For an app that display a permanent notification icon, it should have a high priority notification level, so that it sticks to the left side of the status bar. Currently, when a new notification appears (play store update for example), the netstat icon is shifted to the right and then gets back to its initial position when the other notification disappears.

title: Notification don't show the real connection
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Hi.

I have a new phone since yesterday, Alcatel IDOL4S on Android 6.0.1

I'm very often in 4G Free but sometimes, i'm in 3G or 3G+ on Free / Orange. But the window notification of Free Mobile Netstat always show "Réseau mobile 4G (LTE)" and don't change with the real network connection.

No root, i've gave all the rights i can for this app. Nothing (for me) in Free Mobile Netstat option

Thank you for your return :)

title: Multi-SIM support
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: We should support Multi-SIM phones as far as possible.

title: Notification icon is replaced by launcher's icon on some Huawei Phones
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="wontfix")]
body:
Some Huawei stock ROM set FMN launcher icon as notification icon instead of the one provided by the app. Users must open the app main activity to see on which network they are connected. This seems to reproduce on `Huawei GX8` (and probably some other popular Huawei phones).

I think there no way to fix this (unless Huawei deploys a fix) and we should probably show a dismissable alert.

title: Can't open settings on some Samsung phones
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
On some Samsung phones, the sandwich menu does not show on the top right which makes the user unable to open settings or quit the app.

The issue reproduces on Samsung Galaxy Note 3 Lite. Pressing the physical "menu" button doesn't help.

I think we should display the sandwich in any case, even if the phone has a physical menu button.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3407667/18362342/abb506a8-7605-11e6-927f-20a58a54b660.png)


This seems to only affect OnePlus One (A0001) users. Maybe related to the alarm workaround (see #6).

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3407667/18322945/96c523a2-7535-11e6-8bc6-cc25ef618832.png)

title: Material Design
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: It would be cool to bring Material Design to the app.

title: Improve alarms menu
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: Alarms menu should be complitely rethought. I think it would be better if it were a new menu, still available from settings, but more "event based". Like a simple "+" (a Material Design floating action button ? :stuck_out_tongue_winking_eye: ) that would open a popup to let you choose on which event(s) you want to trigger which alarm.

title: Upgrade to Android Nougat (7.0) SDK
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: And test the update thoroughly! Maybe beta-test it?

title: Detect network bands
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
We should add an "Expert Mode" that tries to detect Free Mobile's bands.

I started to work on this a long time ago, but this work is probably outdated.

See https://github.com/gilbsgilbs/freemobilenetstat/commit/b32df4a3f15629347fe5fe68766e61c15f4dd51a

Once this is implemented, we may think of pushing this statistics into the API.

title: Some Huawei phones need to be in "protected mode" to prevent the system from killing the app in background
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
We should add a popup for impacted phones at the application startup to inform the user that he must "protect" the application to prevent it to be killed by the system while in background.

According to a report I received, this affects all the Huawei's P9 serie.

The menu to protect the app is something like "Gestion du Téléphone" => "Application Protégées". If somebody has a P9, we may be able to hook on the right activity to improve UX.

title: Cell events are not automatically callbacked on some phones
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
This bug is more and more reported, especially since Lollipop and Marshmallow. It seems to impact all OnePlus phones, some Huawei phones, even phones under CyanogenMod (yet, some users reported me it has been fixed some time ago), and probably a lot of other phones.

It appears that the system does not trigger onCellInfoChanged when the app is in background. A workaround has already been implemented for the OnePlus Two. Yet, we would definitely need to generalize this workaround, and just have to set a list of Manufacturer/Models that are known to be impacted.

The workaround is pretty ugly: it consists in triggering the event manually every 5 minutes using an alarm. It does not seem to drain the battery that much though (we may remove the disclaimer).

title: App does not open at phone boot, even when the option in preferences is checked
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body: Seems to be reproductible on a Wiko Rainbow Lite (Android Lollipop 5.1). Maybe on more Wiko phones ?

title: The app may open again after being closed
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body: Sometimes, even if the app was closed using the Close button from the main menu, it opens again magically some minutes or hour later. I think it's easily reproductible.

title: Quitting the app tampers the statistics
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body: A poweroff entry is not inserted into the database after quitting the app from the main menu. When the app is started again, the app considers that the phone has been connected to the same cell since the app was closed. It may distort sent statistics.

title: Minimal contribution guide
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: A short contribution guide would probably help people contributing. Moreover, we should probably add a CONTRIBUTORS.md file to the project root.

title: GitHub links should point to this repository
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
GitHub page of the project should point to this repository (https://github.com/gilbsgilbs/freemobilenetstat) and not vdavy's one (https://github.com/vdavy/freemobilenetstat) which should no longer be used.

I think there is are mention of the GitHub repository in preferences and in changelog.
